CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01A02

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: Ealing Council, Perceval House, 14/16 Uxbridge Road

SHORT_DESCR.P: Ealing Council wishes to procure and provide:
A responsive repairs and maintenance contract for Housing Stock for East and West Wards of the borough and corporate buildings operated by Ealing Facilities Management (2 Contracts).
Copley Close (East Ward of the borough) Responsive Repairs and Voids Contract (1 contract).
Minor Voids Contract borough wide (1 contract).

Contract delivery will be to all our occupied properties, void properties, communal blocks and estate areas, sheltered housing, community centres, Copley Close housing stock and corporate buildings as further described below.

TITLE.P: Responsive Repairs and Maintenance Contract (East and West Wards)

SHORT_DESCR.P: Responsive repairs and maintenance to west ward – Lot 1a and east ward lot 1b contracts.

Responsive repairs and maintenance Service including emergency and adhoc major repairs in our occupied properties, communal blocks and estate areas, sheltered housing, community centres owned and managed by Ealing Council and corporate buildings operated by Ealing Facilities Management. There will be some planned maintenance works, such as guttering and some out of hour’s emergency work. It is to provide a 365 days’ a year, 24 hours a day front line service for and on behalf of Ealing Council. Note: Out of hour’s emergency work means ONLY repairs that are necessary to remove immediate danger, avoid flooding, major damage to property, or to make the property secure. Ealing Council will enter into a contract based upon the JCT Measured Term Contract (MTC) 2016, as amended and incorporating the documents stated in the tender package. It is the intention to award contracts to 2 contractors as detailed below.

The successful tenderer who scores highest in the tender evaluation will be allocated their preferred area / ward and the second most successful tenderer in the evaluation will be allocated the other area / ward. A Contractor will only be appointed to 1 area / ward and not both. The intention is if a Contractor fails delivery due to failure or performance matters in their designated area/ward the Contract will be given to the other Contractor to cover both area / wards for the remainder of the Contract life if they confirm they have the ability to do so. The expected value of each contract will be approximately 1 500 000 GBP to 2 000 000 GBP per annum for each area / ward. Guarantee cannot be given by Ealing Council with regard to the volume, trade requirement, value, duration, category nor continuity of the works.The borough will be split into 2 areas / wards with roughly equal numbers of blocks. The East area comprises W3, W4, W5, W7, W13 and NW10 postcodes. The West comprises UB1, UB2, UB5, UB6, HA0, HA4 and a small number of BN25 postcodes. Some stock is within areas identified for regeneration and development, this is likely to mean that there will be some change in the overall number of blocks and also lead on supply and demand of works during the life of the contract.The overall contract length for all above lots will be for the period of 5 years, unless extended by the Employer with the agreement of the Contractor. The Employer may propose one or more extensions to the contract period up to a maximum of 2 further years by serving written notice to that effect on the Contractor. The contract period is extended if the Contractor agrees to the extension.If you are tendering for multiple lots you will be required to indicate in your tender submission which is your preferred lot as only one lot will be awarded per contractor.
Responsive repairs and maintenance west ward – Lot 1A.
Value excluding VAT: [7 500 000 to 10 000 000] Currency: [G] [B] [P].
Responsive repairs and maintenance east ward – Lot 1B.
Value excluding VAT: [7 500 000 to 10 000 000] Currency: [G] [B] [P].

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The Employer may propose one or more extensions to the contract period up to a maximum of 2 further years by serving written notice to that effect on the Contractor. The contract period is extended if the Contractor agrees to the extension.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: Responsive repairs and maintenance west ward and east ward – Lot 1 a and lot 1B.
Envisage minimum number: 6.
Maximum number: 12.
Objective criteria for choosing the limited number of candidates:
Standard Selection Questionnaire (SQ) evaluation comprises of;
Validity and completeness.

Standard Selection Questionnaire (SQ) with maximum of (3) references sought for Technical and Professional Ability under question 6.1 (Section 6) and each of the technical project specific questions under Additional SQ Modules (Section 8).
The score in Section 8 (Additional SQ Modules) 100%.
Minimum 70% threshold on overall (Technical Project specific questions).
The Tender evaluation comprises four steps;
Validity and completeness.
The Quality Assessment.
The Price Assessment.
Complete tenders will have both the Quality and their Price Assessment considered, both scores will be added together to create an overall “Tender Percentage”.

Ealing Council does not bind itself to accept the lowest or indeed any tender, but is looking for the most economically advantageous tender. Tenders which appear to be abnormally low will be clarified with the Tenderer and may be rejected.

INFO_ADD.P: All expressions of interest / requests for information/tender submissions are to be made via ProContract. https://procontract.due-north.com/Login.

TITLE.P: Copley Close (East Ward) Responsive Repairs and Voids Contract

SHORT_DESCR.P: Copley close responsive repairs and maintenance contract (Falls within east ward) – Lot 2.

Responsive repairs and maintenance Service including emergency and ad-hoc major repairs in occupied properties, communal blocks and estate areas and community centre in our Copley Close Housing Stock which has approximately 370 properties. There will be some out of hour’s emergency work. Note: Out of hour’s emergency work means ONLY repairs that are necessary to remove immediate danger, avoid flooding, major damage to property, or to make the property secure. Ealing Council will enter into a contract based upon the JCT Measured Term Contract (MTC) 2016, as amended and incorporating the documents stated in the tender package. It is the intention to award the contract to a single contractor. The expected value of the contract will be approximately 400 000 GBP to 600 000 GBP total spend per annum. Guarantee cannot be given by Ealing Council with regard to the volume, trade requirement, value, duration, category nor continuity of the works. This estate is currently undergoing redevelopment, this is likely to mean that there will be some change in the overall volume of work. The overall contract length for all above lots will be for the period of 5 years, unless extended by the Employer with the agreement of the Contractor. The Employer may propose 1 or more extensions to the contract period up to a maximum of 2 further years by serving written notice to that effect on the Contractor. The contract period is extended if the Contractor agrees to the extension. If you are tendering for multiple lots you will be required to indicate in your tender submission which is your preferred lot as only one lot will be awarded per contractor.
Copley close responsive repairs and maintenance – Lot 2.
Value excluding VAT: [2 000 000 to 3 000 000] Currency: [G] [B] [P].

Ealing Council would like to draw to the Tenderers attention that during the Contract Period there is a possibility that delivery of the services may be required to its wholly owned subsidiary companies or future companies in which the Council has an interest via Ealing Council. In the event of this occurring the contract terms may require variation, for example, but not limited to, the insurance provisions.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The Employer may propose one or more extensions to the contract period up to a maximum of 2 further years by serving written notice to that effect on the Contractor. The contract period is extended if the Contractor agrees to the extension.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: Copley close responsive repairs and maintenance – Lot 2.
Envisage minimum number: 5.
Maximum number: 10.
Objective criteria for choosing the limited number of candidates:
Standard Selection Questionnaire (SQ) evaluation comprises of;
Validity and completeness.

Standard Selection Questionnaire (SQ) with maximum of (3) references sought for Technical and Professional Ability under question 6.1 (Section 6) and each of the technical project specific questions under Additional SQ Modules (Section 8).
The score in Section 8 (Additional SQ Modules) 100%.
Minimum 70% threshold on overall (Technical Project specific questions).
The Tender evaluation comprises four steps;
Validity and completeness.
The Quality Assessment.
The Price Assessment.
Complete tenders will have both the Quality and their Price Assessment considered, both scores will be added together to create an overall “Tender Percentage”.

Ealing Council does not bind itself to accept the lowest or indeed any tender, but is looking for the most economically advantageous tender. Tenders which appear to be abnormally low will be clarified with the Tenderer and may be rejected.

INFO_ADD.P: All expressions of interest / requests for information / tender submissions are to be made via ProContract. https://procontract.due-north.com/Login.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Minor Voids Service to approximately 600 void properties each year covering refurbishment works which include internal and external repairs and minor refurbishment for up to the value of 15 000 GBP per property. Void reinstatement works will be to a Lettable Standard as defined by Ealing Council and will include for example, but not limited to, the following property types:

General Needs Properties, Sheltered Accommodation Properties,Temporary Accommodation Properties,Hostel Properties,Out of Borough Acquisition Properties,Copley Close properties with enhanced Copley Void Standard,Regeneration properties to include basic or enhanced decommissions. Also, to be included is any work in tenanted properties that is deemed necessary;

Disrepair complaints and identified works, Mutual Exchange works, Decant Properties. The Council will enter into a contract based upon the JCT Measured Term Contract (MTC) 2016, as amended and incorporating the documents stated in the tender package. It is the intention to award the contract to a single contractor. The expected value of the contract will be approximately 1 500 000 GBP to 2 000 000 GBP for total spend per annum. Guarantee cannot be given by Ealing Council with regard to the volume, trade requirement, value, duration, category nor continuity of the works. Some stock is within areas identified for regeneration and development, this is likely to mean that there will be some change in the overall number of blocks and also lead on supply and demand of works during the life of the contract. The overall contract length for all above lots will be for the period of 5 years, unless extended by the Employer with the agreement of the Contractor. The Employer may propose one or more extensions to the contract period up to a maximum of 2 further years by serving written notice to that effect on the Contractor. The contract period is extended if the Contractor agrees to the extension. If you are tendering for multiple lots you will be required to indicate in your tender submission which is your preferred lot as only one lot will be awarded per contractor.
Minor voids contract – Lot 3.
Value excluding VAT: [7 500 000 to 10 000 000] Currency: [G] [B] [P].

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The Employer may propose one or more extensions to the contract period up to a maximum of 2 further years by serving written notice to that effect on the Contractor. The contract period is extended if the Contractor agrees to the extension.

Envisage minimum number: 5.
Maximum number: 10.

Standard Selection Questionnaire (SQ) with maximum of (3) references sought for Technical and Professional Ability under question 6.1 (Section 6) and each of the technical project specific questions under Additional SQ Modules (Section 8).
The score in Section 8 (Additional SQ Modules) 100%.
Minimum 70% threshold on overall (Technical Project specific questions).
The Tender evaluation comprises four steps;
Validity and completeness.
The Quality Assessment.
The Price Assessment.
Complete tenders will have both the Quality and their Price Assessment considered, both scores will be added together to create an overall “Tender Percentage”.

Ealing Council does not bind itself to accept the lowest or indeed any tender, but is looking for the most economically advantageous tender. Tenders which appear to be abnormally low will be clarified with the Tenderer and may be rejected.
